item.title: Patrice add a quote by Sam Hamill
item.description: "Don’t tell me about the seasons in the East, don’t talk to me about eternal California summer. It’s enough to have a few days naked among three hundred kinds of rain." -- Sam Hamill

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Federico Garcia Lorca
item.description:
"Pero yo ya no soy yo Ni mi casa es ya mi casa.
But now I am no longer I, nor is my house any longer my house. " -- Federico Garcia Lorca

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Storm Jameson
item.description: "We need the slower and more lasting stimulus of solitary reading as a relief from the pressure on eye, ear and nerves of the torrent of information and entertainment pouring from ever-open electronic jaws. It could end by stupefying us." -- Storm Jameson

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Federico Garcia Lorca, 1899-1936
item.description: "Verde que te quiero verde. Verde viento. Verde ramas. Green I love you green. Green Wind. Green branches. " -- Federico Garcia Lorca, 1899-1936

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Bill Richardson
item.description: "And so we became who we are: gentle and bookish and ever so slightly confused. It is not a bad way to be, when all is said and done." -- Bill Richardson

item.title: Patrice add a quote by Charles Wright
item.description: "What makes us leave what we love best? What is it inside us that keeps erasing itself When we need it most, That sends us into uncertainty for its own sake And holds us flush there until we begin to love it And have to begin again? What is it within our own lives we decline to live Whenever we find it, making our days unendurable, And nights almost visionless? I still don't know yet, but I do it." -- Charles Wright
